info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:39PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ravalli County through 630 PM MDT... At 539 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darby, or 17 miles south of Hamilton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. Heavy downpours also likely. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Darby, Conner, Charlos Heights and Como. This includes Highway 93 S between mile markers 19 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
